comment.author: 82596826@N03
comment._content:
Caption on photos states it's taken at Karthouse, Coblenz (Koblenz) 1st of October 1919. There appears to be a brass band centre left. The trenches and pock marks in the field beyond would indicate it's a former training ground for Stosstruppen (German storm troops), etc.

At left is a row of captured German aircraft, including what appear to be from L-R a Phalz D.XII, Phalz DIIIa, Albatros DVa (with black and white longtitudinal stripes) and six Fokker DVII.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/landoni/4845018236/in/set-72157606564369342]

At right are eleven American-operated Spad XIII

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/landoni/2873758733/in/set-72157606564369342]

In the foreground row and facing across the field are 18 American operated Salmson 2A2 two seaters

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/landoni/4886783521/in/set-72157606564369342]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/landoni/4886783523/in/set-72157606564369342]
